name: Gcloud
title: Gcloud
description:
Google Cloud

Gcloud is the official library for interacting with the Google Cloud Platform. Google Cloud Platform is a set of modular cloud-based services that allow you to create anything from simple websites to complex applications.

Gcloud’s goal is to provide a API that is familiar and comfortable to Rubyists. Authentication is handled by providing project and credential information, or if you are running on Google Compute Engine this configuration is taken care of for you.

You can learn more about various options for connection on the Authentication Guide.

methods.name: new
title: Gcloud.new
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to Google Cloud.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore
pubsub  = gcloud.pubsub
storage = gcloud.storage

params.name: project
params.description:
Project identifier for the Pub/Sub service you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

methods.name: datastore
title: Gcloud#datastore
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore

task = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

datastore.save task

examples.caption: You shouldn’t need to override the default scope, but you can:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
datastore = gcloud.datastore scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/datastore

methods.name: storage
title: Gcloud#storage
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Storage service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage
bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_only"
readonly_storage = gcloud.storage scope: readonly_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control

methods.name: pubsub
title: Gcloud#pubsub
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Pub/Sub service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.publish "task completed"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/pubsub

methods.name: bigquery
title: Gcloud#bigquery
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the BigQuery service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my-dataset"
table = dataset.table "my-table"
table.data.each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery

methods.name: dns
title: Gcloud#dns
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-zone"
zone.records.each do |record|
  puts record.name
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readonly"
dns = gcloud.dns scope: readonly_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readwrite

methods.name: resource_manager
title: Gcloud#resource_manager
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Resource Manager service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
resource_manager.projects.each do |project|
  puts projects.project_id
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloudresourcemanager.readonly"
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager scope: readonly_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

methods.name: logging
title: Gcloud#logging
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Logging service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
# ...

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
logging = gcloud.logging scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/logging.admin

methods.name: translate
title: Gcloud#translate
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Translate service. Each call creates a new connection.

Unlike other Cloud Platform services, which authenticate using a project ID and OAuth 2.0 credentials, Google Translate API requires a public API access key. (This may change in future releases of Google Translate API.) Follow the general instructions at Identifying your application to Google, and the specific instructions for Server keys.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
translate = gcloud.translate "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

examples.caption: Using API Key from the environment variable.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

ENV["TRANSLATE_KEY"] = "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
translate = gcloud.translate

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

params.name: key
params.description: a public API access key (not an OAuth 2.0 token)

methods.name: vision
title: Gcloud#vision
methods.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Vision service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
vision = gcloud.vision

image = vision.image "path/to/landmark.jpg"

landmark = image.landmark
landmark.description #=> "Mount Rushmore"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
vision = gcloud.vision scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

methods.name: dns
title: Gcloud.dns
methods.description:
Creates a new Project instance connected to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

dns = Gcloud.dns "my-dns-project",
                 "/path/to/keyfile.json"

zone = dns.zone "example-com"

params.name: project
params.description:
Identifier for a DNS project. If not present, the
default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readwrite

methods.name: storage
title: Gcloud.storage
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Storage service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:

storage = Gcloud.storage "my-todo-project",
                         "/path/to/keyfile.json"

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

params.name: project
params.description:
Project identifier for the Storage service you are

params.name: keyfile
params.description:

methods.name: datastore
title: Gcloud.datastore
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "gcloud/datastore"

datastore = Gcloud.datastore "my-todo-project",
                           "/path/to/keyfile.json"

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

datastore.save task

params.name: project
params.description:
Dataset identifier for the Datastore you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/datastore

methods.name: translate
title: Gcloud.translate
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Translate service. Each call creates a new connection.

Unlike other Cloud Platform services, which authenticate using a project ID and OAuth 2.0 credentials, Google Translate API requires a public API access key. (This may change in future releases of Google Translate API.) Follow the general instructions at Identifying your application to Google, and the specific instructions for Server keys.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

translate = Gcloud.translate "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

examples.caption: Using API Key from the environment variable.
examples.code:

ENV["TRANSLATE_KEY"] = "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

translate = Gcloud.translate

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

params.name: key
params.description: a public API access key (not an OAuth 2.0 token)
